meanings.def: a duty, responsibility, etc. that causes worry, difficulty or hard work
examples: the burden (of something) The main burden of caring for old people falls on the state.
burden on somebody the heavy tax burden on working people
a burden to somebody I don't want to become a burden to my children when I'm old.

meanings.def: a heavy load that is difficult to carry
to give somebody a duty, responsibility, etc. that causes worry, difficulty or hard work
examples: They have burdened themselves with a high mortgage.
I don't want to burden you with my worries.
to be burdened by high taxation
She got off the bus, burdened with two heavy suitcases.
